intro: Psychotria rufipila, commonly known as the "red-stemmed psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its reddish stems and small, dark green leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Psychotria rufipila is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
